info.title: Listen Notes Podcast Search Engine and Database Plugin
info.description: A plugin that allows the user to discover podcasts and episodes using ChatGPT.

get.description: Search podcasts by keyword. A keyword can be a topic, a person name, a place, or a brand. Useful to discover podcasts by hosts, topics, publishers, etc. Also useful to find podcasts by name.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A keyword to search, which could be person, place, topic...You can use double quotes to do verbatim match, e.g., "game of thrones". Otherwise, it's fuzzy search.

parameters.name: sort_by_date
parameters.description: Sort by published date or not? If 0, then sort by relevance. If 1, then sort by published date.

parameters.name: len_min
parameters.description: Minimum audio length for episode in minutes.

parameters.name: len_max
parameters.description: Maximum audio length for episode in minutes.

parameters.name: published_before
parameters.description: Only show results published before this timestamp (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: published_after
parameters.description: Only show results published after this timestamp (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: only_in
parameters.description: A comma-delimited string to search only in specific fields. Allowed values are title, description, author, and audio. If not specified, then search every fields.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Limit search results to a specific language. If not specified, it'll be any language. Get a list of supported languages from the `getLanguages` endpoint

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Limit search results to a specific region (e.g., us, gb, in...). If not specified, it'll be any region. Get the supported country codes from the `getRegions` endpoint

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results per page. A valid value should be an integer between 1 and 10 (inclusive).

parameters.name: episode_count_min
parameters.description: Minimum number of episodes.

parameters.name: episode_count_max
parameters.description: Maximum number of episodes.

parameters.name: update_freq_min
parameters.description: Minimum update frequency in hours. For example, if you want to find "weekly" podcasts, then you can set **update_freq_min**=144 hours (or 6 days) and **update_freq_max**=192 hours (or 8 days).

parameters.name: update_freq_max
parameters.description: Minimum update frequency in hours. For example, if you want to find "weekly" podcasts, then you can set **update_freq_min**=144 hours (or 6 days) and **update_freq_max**=192 hours (or 8 days).

200.description: Returns a list of podcasts in json format

id.description: the id of the podcast, which can be used to pass to the other endpoints that need a podcast id as a parameter

description.description: description of the podcast in html

listennotes_url.description: the canonical url of the podcast on Listen Notes, which can be used to manually share this podcast

latest_episode_id.description: the id of the latest episode of the podcast, which can be used to fetch detailed metadata of the episode using the `getEpisode` endpoint

latest_pub_date_ms.description: published date of the latest episode of this podcast in milliseconds of the Unix epoch

earliest_pub_date_ms.description: The published date of the oldest episode of this podcast. In milliseconds

total_episodes.description: Total number of episodes in this podcast.

audio_length_sec.description: Average audio length of all episodes of this podcast. In seconds.

update_frequency_hours.description: How frequently does this podcast release a new episode? In hours. For example, if the value is 166, then it's every 166 hours (or weekly).

listen_score.description: Listen Score of the podcast, which indicates the estimated popularity of the podcast (similar to nielsen ratings)

listen_score_global_rank.description: the global rank of the podcast according to Listen Score

get.description: Search episodes by keyword. A keyword can be a topic, a person name, a place, or a brand. Useful to find podcast interviews of a person, or episodes discussing a specific topic / person.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A keyword to search, which could be person, place, topic...You can use double quotes to do verbatim match, e.g., "game of thrones". Otherwise, it's fuzzy search.

parameters.name: sort_by_date
parameters.description: Sort by published date or not? If 0, then sort by relevance. If 1, then sort by published date.

parameters.name: len_min
parameters.description: Minimum audio length for episode in minutes.

parameters.name: len_max
parameters.description: Maximum audio length for episode in minutes.

parameters.name: published_before
parameters.description: Only show results published before this timestamp (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: published_after
parameters.description: Only show results published after this timestamp (in milliseconds).

parameters.name: only_in
parameters.description: A comma-delimited string to search only in specific fields. Allowed values are title, description, author, and audio. If not specified, then search every fields.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Limit search results to a specific language. If not specified, it'll be any language. Get a list of supported languages from the `getLanguages` endpoint

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Limit search results to a specific region (e.g., us, gb, in...). If not specified, it'll be any region. Get the supported country codes from the `getRegions` endpoint

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results per page. A valid value should be an integer between 1 and 10 (inclusive).

200.description: Returns a list of podcast episodes in json format

id.description: the id of the episode, which can be used to pass to the other endpoints that need an episode id as a parameter

description.description: description of the podcast episode in html

image.description: image url of the podcast episode

audio.description: audio url of the podcast episode, used for playing the audio

audio_length_sec.description: audio length of the podcast episode in seconds

pub_date_ms.description: published date of the podcast episode in milliseconds of the Unix epoch

listennotes_url.description: the canonical url of the podcast episode on Listen Notes, which can be used to manually share this episode

podcast.description: the podcast that this episode belongs to

id.description: the id of the podcast, which can be used to pass to the other endpoints that need a podcast id as a parameter

listen_score.description: Listen Score of the podcast, which indicates the estimated popularity of the podcast (similar to nielsen ratings)

listen_score_global_rank.description: the global rank of the podcast according to Listen Score

listennotes_url.description: the canonical url of the podcast on Listen Notes, which can be used to manually share this podcast

get.description: Fetch a list of best podcasts by genre, region, and language.Get the genre ids from the `getGenres` endpoint

parameters.name: genre_id
parameters.description: Narrow down results for a specific podcast genre. Get the id from the `getGenres` endpoint.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Filter best podcasts by country/region. Get the supported country codes (e.g., us, jp, gb...) from the `getRegions` endpoint.

parameters.name: publisher_region
parameters.description: Filter best podcasts by the publisher's country/region. Get the supported country codes (e.g., us, jp, gb...) from the `getRegions` endpoint.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Limit search results to a specific language. If not specified, it'll be any language. Get a list of supported languages from the `getLanguages` endpoint

200.description: Returns a list of podcasts in json format

id.description: the id of the podcast, which can be used to pass to the other endpoints that need a podcast id as a parameter

description.description: description of the podcast in html

listennotes_url.description: the canonical url of the podcast on Listen Notes, which can be used to manually share this podcast

latest_episode_id.description: the id of the latest episode of the podcast, which can be used to fetch detailed metadata of the episode using the `getEpisode` endpoint

latest_pub_date_ms.description: published date of the latest episode of this podcast in milliseconds of the Unix epoch

earliest_pub_date_ms.description: The published date of the oldest episode of this podcast. In milliseconds

total_episodes.description: Total number of episodes in this podcast.

audio_length_sec.description: Average audio length of all episodes of this podcast. In seconds.

update_frequency_hours.description: How frequently does this podcast release a new episode? In hours. For example, if the value is 166, then it's every 166 hours (or weekly).

listen_score.description: Listen Score of the podcast, which indicates the estimated popularity of the podcast (similar to nielsen ratings)

get.description: Get a random podcast episode, with all necessary metadata to describe this episode and stream the audio.Recently published episodes are more likely to be fetched.

200.description: Returns a json object with the podcast episode data

id.description: the id of the episode, which can be used to pass to the other endpoints that need an episode id as a parameter

description.description: description of the podcast episode in html

image.description: image url of the podcast episode

audio.description: audio url of the podcast episode, used for playing the audio

audio_length_sec.description: audio length of the podcast episode in seconds

pub_date_ms.description: published date of the podcast episode in milliseconds of the Unix epoch

listennotes_url.description: the canonical url of the podcast episode on Listen Notes, which can be used to manually share this episode

podcast.description: the podcast that this episode belongs to

id.description: the id of the podcast, which can be used to pass to the other endpoints that need a podcast id as a parameter

listen_score.description: Listen Score of the podcast, which indicates the estimated popularity of the podcast (similar to nielsen ratings)

listen_score_global_rank.description: the global rank of the podcast according to Listen Score

listennotes_url.description: the canonical url of the podcast on Listen Notes, which can be used to manually share this podcast

get.description: Fetch a list of podcast genres. The `id` field can be used in other endpoints as `genre_id` parameter.

200.description: Returns a list of podcast genres in json format

id.description: The id of this genre, which can be used in the `genre_ids` parameter in other endpoints.

get.description: Fetch a list of supported languages for podcasts. Use the language name as `language` parameter in other endpoints.

200.description: Returns a list of podcast languages in json format

items.description: Human readable language name (e.g., English). Use this as `language` parameter in other endpoints.

get.description: Fetch a list of supported countries/regions. The key of the returned json object is the region code (e.g., us, gb...) used in other endpoints as `region` parameter.

200.description: Returns a json object of countries/regions. The key is the region code (e.g., us, gb), and the value is the human-readable region name (e.g., United States)

get.description: Fetch detailed meta data for an episode by id. The `id` parameter of this endpoint can be obtained from the response of other endpoints.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id for a specific episode, which can be obtained id from the response of other endpoints.

200.description: Returns a json object with the podcast episode data

id.description: the id of the episode, which can be used to pass to the other endpoints that need an episode id as a parameter

description.description: description of the podcast episode in html

image.description: image url of the podcast episode

audio.description: audio url of the podcast episode, used for playing the audio

audio_length_sec.description: audio length of the podcast episode in seconds

pub_date_ms.description: published date of the podcast episode in milliseconds of the Unix epoch

listennotes_url.description: the canonical url of the podcast episode on Listen Notes, which can be used to manually share this episode

listen_score_global_rank.description: the global rank of the podcast according to Listen Score

listennotes_url.description: the canonical url of the podcast on Listen Notes, which can be used to manually share this podcast

get.description: Fetch detailed meta data for a podcast by id, including up to 10 episodes. The `id` parameter of this endpoint can be obtained from the response of other endpoints.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id for a specific podcast, which can be obtained id from the response of other endpoints.

200.description: Returns a json object with the podcast metadata

id.description: the id of the podcast, which can be used to pass to the other endpoints that need a podcast id as a parameter

description.description: description of the podcast in html

listennotes_url.description: the canonical url of the podcast on Listen Notes, which can be used to manually share this podcast

id.description: the id of the episode, which can be used to pass to the other endpoints that need an episode id as a parameter
